009package imagingbook.common.color.quantize;
010
011import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
012import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
013import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
014
015import java.awt.image.IndexColorModel;
016
017import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
018
019public interface ColorQuantizer {
020        
021        public static final int MAX_RGB = 255;
022
023        /**
024         * Retrieves the color map produced by this color quantizer. The returned array is in the format float[idx][rgb],
025         * where rgb = 0 (red), 1 (green), 2 (blue) and  0 &le; idx &lt; nColors.
026         *
027         * @return The table of reference (quantization) colors.
028         */
029        public float[][] getColorMap();
030        
031        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
032        
033        /**
034         * Returns the number of quantized colors.
035         * 
036         * @return the number of quantized colors
037         */
038        public default int getColorCount() {
039                return getColorMap().length;
040        }
041
042
043        /**
044         * Performs color quantization on the given full-color RGB image and creates an indexed color image.
045         *
046         * @param cp The original full-color RGB image.
047         * @return The quantized (indexed color) image.
048         */
049        public default ByteProcessor quantize(ColorProcessor cp) {
050                float[][] colormap = this.getColorMap();
051                if (colormap.length > 256) 
052                        throw new RuntimeException("cannot index to more than 256 colors");
053                
054                int w = cp.getWidth();
055                int h = cp.getHeight();
056                
057                int[]  rgbPixels = (int[]) cp.getPixels();
058                byte[] idxPixels = new byte[rgbPixels.length];
059
060                for (int i = 0; i < rgbPixels.length; i++) {
061                        idxPixels[i] = (byte) findColorIndex(rgbPixels[i], colormap);
062                }
063
064                IndexColorModel idxCm = makeIndexColorModel(colormap);
065                return new ByteProcessor(w, h, idxPixels, idxCm);
066        }
067        
068        static IndexColorModel makeIndexColorModel(float[][] colormap) {
069                final int nColors = colormap.length;
070                byte[] rMap = new byte[nColors];
071                byte[] gMap = new byte[nColors];
072                byte[] bMap = new byte[nColors];
073                for (int i = 0; i < nColors; i++) {
074                        rMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][0]);
075                        gMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][1]);
076                        bMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][2]);
077                }
078                return new IndexColorModel(8, nColors, rMap, gMap, bMap);
079        }
080        
081        static byte floatToUnsignedByte(float x) {
082                int xi = Math.round(x);
083                if (xi < 0) {
084                        xi = 0;
085                }
086                else if (xi > MAX_RGB) {
087                        xi = MAX_RGB;
088                }
089                return (byte) (0xFF & xi);
090        }
091
092        /**
093         * Performs color quantization on the given array of ARGB-encoded color values and returns a new sequence of
094         * quantized colors.
095         *
096         * @param origPixels The original ARGB-encoded color values.
097         * @return The quantized ARGB-encoded color values.
098         */
099        public default int[] quantize(int[] origPixels) {
100                int[] qantPixels = new int[origPixels.length];
101                for (int i = 0; i < origPixels.length; i++) {
102                        qantPixels[i] = quantize(origPixels[i]);
103                }
104                return qantPixels;
105        }
106
107        /**
108         * Performs color quantization on the given single ARGB-encoded color value and returns the associated quantized
109         * color.
110         *
111         * @param rgb The original ARGB-encoded color value.
112         * @return The quantized ARGB-encoded color value.
113         */
114        public default int quantize(int rgb) {
115                final float[][] colormap = getColorMap();
116                int idx = findColorIndex(rgb, colormap);
117                int red = (int) (colormap[idx][0] + 0.5f);
118                int grn = (int) (colormap[idx][1] + 0.5f);
119                int blu = (int) (colormap[idx][2] + 0.5f);
120                return RgbUtils.encodeRgbToInt(red, grn, blu);
121        }
122
123        /**
124         * Finds the color table index of the color that is "closest" to the supplied RGB color (minimum Euclidean distance
125         * in color space). This method may be overridden by inheriting classes, for example, to use quick indexing in the
126         * octree method.
127         *
128         * @param p Original color, encoded as an ARGB integer.
129         * @param colormap a color map (float)
130         * @return The associated color table index.
131         */
132        default int findColorIndex(int p, float[][] colormap) {
133                int[] rgb = RgbUtils.intToRgb(p);
134                int n = colormap.length;
135                float minD2 = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
136                int minIdx = -1;
137                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
138                        final float red = colormap[i][0];
139                        final float grn = colormap[i][1];
140                        final float blu = colormap[i][2];
141                        float d2 = sqr(red - rgb[0]) + sqr(grn - rgb[1]) + sqr(blu - rgb[2]);   // dist^2
142                        if (d2 < minD2) {
143                                minD2 = d2;
144                                minIdx = i;
145                        }
146                }
147                return minIdx;
148        }
149
150}
